intro: Bossiaea leptacantha, commonly known as the slender bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and woodland environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Bossiaea leptacantha is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, such as parts of Western Australia.
